1776: The United States Declaration of Independence was adopted.
1789: The French Revolution began with the storming of the Bastille.
1969: Apollo 11 landed on the Moon, and Neil Armstrong became the first human to walk on its surface.
1989: The Berlin Wall fell, marking the beginning of the end of the Cold War.
2001: Terrorist attacks destroyed the Twin Towers in New York City.
1991: The Soviet Union dissolved, marking the end of the Cold War.
1215: The Magna Carta was signed in England.
1607: Jamestown, the first permanent English settlement in the Americas, was founded.
1804: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself Emperor of France.
1920: The League of Nations was established.
1957: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik, the first artificial satellite.
1066: The Norman conquest of England began.
1871: The unification of Germany was completed.
1963: Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his 'I Have a Dream' speech.
1980: Mount St. Helens erupted in Washington State.
1994: Nelson Mandela became South Africa's first black president.
753 BC: Rome was founded, according to legend.
800: Charlemagne was crowned Emperor of the Romans.
1347: The Black Death began in Europe.
1494: The Treaty of Tordesillas was signed.
1517: Martin Luther started the Protestant Reformation.
1588: The Spanish Armada was defeated by England.
1648: The Peace of Westphalia ended the Thirty Years' War.
1805: The Battle of Trafalgar took place.
1815: Napoleon was defeated at the Battle of Waterloo.
1863: The Emancipation Proclamation was issued in the United States.
1879: Thomas Edison invented the electric light bulb.
1903: The Wright brothers achieved the first powered flight.
1929: The Wall Street Crash triggered the Great Depression.
1941: The attack on Pearl Harbor brought the United States into World War II.
1961: Yuri Gagarin became the first human in space.
2004: The Indian Ocean tsunami caused widespread devastation.
2016: The United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union (Brexit).
2022: The James Webb Space Telescope began operations.
